meanings.definition: The beliefs or opinions that are generally held about someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her reputations in the town were always positive.
meanings.sent2: His reputations as a reliable worker helped him get the promotion.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the talking dog only added to his reputations in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, a good reputation can open many doors.
meanings.sent5: The reputations of the twins were so similar that people often mistook them for each other.

meanings.definition: The state of being admired or respected by others.
meanings.sent1: The actress gained a strong reputations for her charity work.
meanings.sent2: His reputations among his peers was unmatched.
meanings.sent3: The cat's reputations for catching mice made it a local hero.
meanings.sent4: The old tree had a reputation for being the tallest in the forest.
meanings.sent5: Her reputation as a talented artist spread far and wide.

meanings.definition: The overall quality or character as seen or judged by people in general.
meanings.sent1: The company's reputation for honesty attracted many customers.
meanings.sent2: His reputation for kindness was well-known in the community.
meanings.sent3: The reputation of the haunted house made it a popular tourist attraction.
meanings.sent4: The reputation of the chef's restaurant spread through word of mouth.
meanings.sent5: The reputation of the ancient castle added to its mystique.
